feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The student clearly defined and implemented a working financial tool (an SWR calculator) and demonstrated its functionality with multiple simulations and concrete outputs (portfolio trajectories, withdrawals, survival rates). The DRIVER stages (Discover, Implement, Validate/Reflect) provide direct evidence that the app performs financial tasks, meeting the PASS standard for thoroughness.
- Integrate AI: The student shows concrete, repeated use of AI (Gemini + Google AI Studio) to design, implement, and validate the SWR tool, including AI-generated prompts, scenario inputs, and human-readable explanations of year-by-year actions. They also reflect on limitations and prompt engineering, indicating substantive integration rather than superficial use.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "I decided to make a safe withdrawal safe withdrawal rate calculator or SWR ... which is used to tell a retiree or a person who's recently retired how much they can spend in a certain year"
"I developed the app using Google AI Studio."

"it shows us a portfolio trajectory, how much we'll have left per year ... it shows the outcome of survival as in how much you'll have positive funds in your account ... how much they'll withdraw over the 30 years ... and then the final balance"
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover (defined the SWR decision and goals), Implement (built the app in Google AI Studio and used Gemini to generate prompts), Validate/Reflect (ran multiple market scenarios and reviewed simulation outputs and ledger actions).
criteria.reasoning: The student clearly defined and implemented a working financial tool (an SWR calculator) and demonstrated its functionality with multiple simulations and concrete outputs (portfolio trajectories, withdrawals, survival rates). The DRIVER stages (Discover, Implement, Validate/Reflect) provide direct evidence that the app performs financial tasks, meeting the PASS standard for thoroughness.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "I developed the app using Google AI Studio."
"I use Google Gemini to help come up with the idea and using that information generate a prompt to input it into Google AI Studio."

"this ledger details part was part of my second loop where I wanted to help it to explain better, you know, how to um yeah, explain in words the actions to take um and how that would affect our withdrawal amount in our portfolio."
criteria.driver_alignment: Implemented (developed the app in Google AI Studio), Represent (used AI/Gemini to decide what calculations and outputs to include), Validate (Gemini generated test inputs and scenarios), Reflect (noted prompt-engineering challenges and need for further loops).
criteria.reasoning: The student shows concrete, repeated use of AI (Gemini + Google AI Studio) to design, implement, and validate the SWR tool, including AI-generated prompts, scenario inputs, and human-readable explanations of year-by-year actions. They also reflect on limitations and prompt engineering, indicating substantive integration rather than superficial use.
